excerpt: Ballard, Big Brother, Foundation, Dexter: Resurrection and more! Find out what's new, returning and leaving the small screen this week.

html:
To help you anticipate and navigate all that television has to offer across broadcast, cable and streaming, TVLine offers daily, weekly and monthly What to Watch digests, as well as an overview of every new TV show premiering in 2025.

This week, youâ€™ll find 15 series premieres (including Dexter: Resurrection and the Bosch: Legacy spinoff Ballard), 20 returning series (including the returns of Big Brother, Impractical Jokers and Itâ€™s Always Sunny in Philadelphia) and a dozen finales (including Criminal Minds, Murderbot and Poker Face).

Want scoop on any of the following shows? Email usÂ and your question may be answered in Mattâ€™s Inside Line.

SUNDAY, JULY 6

ğŸ¦ˆ Shark Quest: Hunt for the Apex Predator (Disney+ and Hulu, two-episode binge)
Survivors recount their harrowing encounters with massive sharks, where some emerged miraculously unscathed and others were less fortunate. (Airs Sunday, July 13 on NatGeo.)

ğŸ¦ˆ Sharks of the North (Disney+ and Hulu special)
Alanna Canaran, a passionate science educator and dive instructor, embarks on a mission to unravel the enigmas surrounding great white sharks. (Airs Saturday, July 12 on NatGeo.)

ğŸ“º 8 pm 90 Day FiancÃ©: Happily Ever After? Season 9 (TLC)

ğŸ“º 11 pm 90 Day Pillow Talk: Happily Ever After? Season 9 (TLC)

ğŸ¥ Going, Going, Gone: The Magic of the Home Run (The Roku Channel documentary)
Roy Wood Jr. goes to different ballparks and other baseball landmarks across the country to revisit some of the most memorable home runs in history; talking heads include Mookie Betts, Freddie Freeman, Chris Berman, Bob Costas and Albert Pujols.

ğŸ“º Art Detectives Season 1 finale (Acorn TV)

The four-part docuseries sees Hallmark fans and stars (including Jonathan Bennett, Nikki DeLoach, Sarah Drew,Â Tyler Hynes and Andrew Walker) aboard the inaugural Hallmark Christmas Cruise.

ğŸ“º 10 pm Jake Makes It Easy Season 2 (FYI)

ğŸ“º 10 pm Survival Mode (NBC, next day on Peacock)
Follow everyday people through the most harrowing moments of their lives â€” including Hurricane Ian, the Maui wildfires, the derailment of Amtrak 501, Hurricane Sandy, and the sinking of Costa Concordia â€” when every split-second decision can mean the difference between life and death.

ğŸ“º 10:30 pm Born to be Viral docuseries finale (Freeform)

ğŸ¥ 8 pm Jim Thorpe: Lit by Lightning (History Channel documentary)
The film chronicles the life of one of the greatest and most versatile athletes of modern sports â€” the United Statesâ€™ first Native American Olympic gold medalist.Â 

TUESDAY, JULY 8

ğŸ“º Quarterback Season 2 (Netflix, eight-episode binge)

The three-part docuseries explores the lives and rivalries of three towering figures of the Italian Renaissance â€“ Michelangelo, Leonardo da Vinci and Raphael.

ğŸ“º 10 pm Fatal Destination Season 1 finale (Investigation Discovery)
ğŸ“º 10 pm 1000-lb Roomies Season 1 finale (TLC)

ğŸ¤£ Nate Jackson: Super Funny (Netflix comedy special)

ğŸ¥ Simple Plan: The Kids in the Crowd (Prime Video documentary)
The punk-rock superstars recount the highs and lows of the first 25 years of their career.

WEDNESDAY, JULY 9

ğŸ“º Ballard (Prime Video, 10-episode binge)
Detective RenÃ©e Ballard (Maggie Q) leads the LAPDâ€™s new cold case division with a dedicated team of volunteers and limited resources.

ğŸ“º Building the Band (Netflix, four-episode premiere)
AJ McLean hosts this music competition, while Nicole Scherzinger serves as mentor and judge; Kelly Rowland and the late Liam Payne are guest judges.

ğŸ“º 8 pm Celebrity IOU Season 10 (HGTV)
ğŸ“º 9 pm Itâ€™s Always Sunny in Philadelphia Season 17 (FXX, two-episode premiere)

Participants at the â€œRewind Retreatâ€ include Aubrey Oâ€™Day, Kim Zolciak, Brielle Biermann, Jessica Dime, Larissa Santos Lima, Sebastian Bails, Sophia Elgerabli, Alan McGarry and Kathy Brown; Michelle Visage hosts.

THURSDAY, JULY 10

ğŸ“º American Gangster: Trap Queens Season 4 (BET+, five-episode premiere)

ğŸ“º Back to the Frontier (Max)
Three American families reimagine their lives as 1880s homesteaders, foregoing the comforts of present day for a more analog life on the frontier.

From Lena Dunham comes the story of a New Yorker (Megan Stalter) who heads to London in the wake of a painful breakup.

ğŸ“º 8:35 pm Electric Boom (Disney Channel, two-episode premiere)
In this comedy, members of a mega-famous female pop group tell the story of their band and friendship, starting with the day they all met in high school.

ğŸ“º 9 pm Chasing the West (HGTV)
The Property Brothers take families who wish to escape hectic city life (or own land) to discover the incredible attributes and unique challenges of ranch living.

ğŸ“º 9 pm Lie Detector: Truth or Deception (A&E)

ğŸ¦ˆ 9 pm Jaws @ 50: The Definitive Inside Story (NatGeo documentary)
Steven Spielberg dives back into the story that launched his career and earned him final cut on the film â€” a creative control he has maintained for the last 50 years.

FRIDAY, JULY 11

ğŸ“º Dexter: Resurrection (Paramount+ Premium, two-episode premiere)

ğŸ“º The Wild Ones (Apple TV+, six-episode binge)
The docuseries follows an elite trio of wildlife experts as they embark on high-stakes expeditions across the globe to track and protect the planetâ€™s most endangered species.

ğŸ“º 8 pm Katie Taylor vs. Amanda Serrano 3 (Netflix live event)
ğŸ“º 9 pm The Great American Recipe Season 4 (PBS)

ğŸ¥ Drop (Peacock)

ğŸ¥ Get Off My Lawn (Tubi movie)
A suburban couple (Tahj Mowry and Camila Banus) is terrorized by a deranged teenager and his friends after they purchase his grandfatherâ€™s sacred home.

ğŸ¥ Madeaâ€™s Destination Wedding (Netflix movie)
Madea packs her best floral dresses â€” and a whole lot of chaos â€” when the Simmons family heads to the Bahamas for her grandnieceâ€™s whirlwind wedding.

ğŸ¥ Opus (Max)

ğŸ¥ Push (Shudder movie)
When a violent attack at her open house sends her into premature labor, a pregnant realtor (Alicia Sanz) must find a way to escape before she gives birth.

ğŸ¥ 9 pm Marcella (PBS documentary)
The latest installment of American Masters heads into the kitchen to explore the improbable, inspiring and delicious life and influence of iconic cookbook authorÂ Marcella Hazan.

SATURDAY, JULY 12

ğŸ“º 11 am Oceanfront Property Hunt Season 1B (A&E, two-episode premiere)

ğŸ“º 1 pm Betting on Beloit (A&E, two-episode premiere)
Konya Hendricks Schuh taps into her background in real estate and design to renovate neglected properties in Beloits historic Wisconsin district.

ğŸ“º 4 pm WWE: The Great American Bash (Peacock live event)
ğŸ“º 9 pm Mysteries From Above Season 2 (History)

What are you watching this week? Take stock of everything above, then drop a comment with your lists below.
